Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַבָּאִ֖ים מִצְרָ֑יְמָה אֵ֣ת יַעֲקֹ֔ב אִ֥ישׁ וּבֵית֖וֹ בָּֽאוּ׃
Translit: veʾēlleh shemōth benē yisråʾēl habbåʾîm mitṣråymåh ʾēth yaʿaqōv ʾîsh ūvēthō båʾū
English: Now these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob.

Hebrew: רְאוּבֵ֣ן שִׁמְע֔וֹן לֵוִ֖י וִיהוּדָֽה׃
Translit: reʾūvēn shimʿōn lēvî vîhūdhåh
English: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,

Hebrew: יִשָּׂשכָ֥ר זְבוּלֻ֖ן וּבְנְיָמִֽן׃
Translit: yissåshkhår zevūlun ūveneyåmin
English: Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,

Hebrew: דָּ֥ן וְנַפְתָּלִ֖י גָּ֥ד וְאָשֵֽׁר׃
Translit: dån venaftålî gådh veʾåshēr
English: Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֗י כָּל־נֶ֛פֶשׁ יֹצְאֵ֥י יֶֽרֶךְ־יַעֲקֹ֖ב שִׁבְעִ֣ים נָ֑פֶשׁ וְיוֹסֵ֖ף הָיָ֥ה בְמִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayhî kål-nefesh yōtṣeʾē yerekh-yaʿaqōv shivʿîm nåfesh veyōsēf håyåh vemitṣråyim
English: And all the souls that came out of the loins of Jacob were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤מָת יוֹסֵף֙ וְכָל־אֶחָ֔יו וְכֹ֖ל הַדּ֥וֹר הַהֽוּא׃
Translit: vayyåmåth yōsēf vekhål-ʾeḥåv vekhōl haddōr hahūʾ
English: And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל פָּר֧וּ וַֽיִּשְׁרְצ֛וּ וַיִּרְבּ֥וּ וַיַּֽעַצְמ֖וּ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ אֹתָֽם׃
Translit: ūvenē yisråʾēl pårū vayyishretṣū vayyirbū vayyaʿatṣmū bimʾōdh meʾōdh vattimmålēʾ håʾåretṣ ʾōthåm
English: And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and waxed exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥קָם מֶֽלֶךְ־חָדָ֖שׁ עַל־מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָדַ֖ע אֶת־יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translit: vayyåqåm melekh-ḥådhåsh ʿal-mitṣråyim ʾasher lōʾ-yådhaʿ ʾeth-yōsēf
English: Now there arose up a new king over Egypt, which knew not Joseph.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֶל־עַמּ֑וֹ הִנֵּ֗ה עַ֚ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רַ֥ב וְעָצ֖וּם מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾel-ʿammō hinnēh ʿam benē yisråʾēl rav veʿåtṣūm mimmennū
English: And he said unto his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we:

Hebrew: הָ֥בָה נִֽתְחַכְּמָ֖ה ל֑וֹ פֶּן־יִרְבֶּ֗ה וְהָיָ֞ה כִּֽי־תִקְרֶ֤אנָה מִלְחָמָה֙ וְנוֹסַ֤ף גַּם־הוּא֙ עַל־שֹׂ֣נְאֵ֔ינוּ וְנִלְחַם־בָּ֖נוּ וְעָלָ֥ה מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translit: håvåh nithḥakkemåh lō pen-yirbeh vehåyåh kî-thiqreʾnåh milḥåmåh venōsaf gam-hūʾ ʿal-sōneʾēnū venilḥam-bånū veʿålåh min-håʾåretṣ
English: Come on, let us deal wisely with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there falleth out any war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight against us, and so get them up out of the land.

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֤ימוּ עָלָיו֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מִסִּ֔ים לְמַ֥עַן עַנֹּת֖וֹ בְּסִבְלֹתָ֑ם וַיִּ֜בֶן עָרֵ֤י מִסְכְּנוֹת֙ לְפַרְעֹ֔ה אֶת־פִּתֹ֖ם וְאֶת־רַעַמְסֵֽס׃
Translit: vayyåsîmū ʿålåv sårē missîm lemaʿan ʿannōthō besivlōthåm vayyiven ʿårē miskenōth lefarʿōh ʾeth-pithōm veʾeth-raʿamsēs
English: Therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh treasure cities, Pithom and Raamses.

Hebrew: וְכַאֲשֶׁר֙ יְעַנּ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ כֵּ֥ן יִרְבֶּ֖ה וְכֵ֣ן יִפְרֹ֑ץ וַיָּקֻ֕צוּ מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: vekhaʾasher yeʿannū ʾōthō kēn yirbeh vekhēn yifrōtṣ vayyåqutṣū mippenē benē yisråʾēl
English: But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were grieved because of the children of Israel.

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבִ֧דוּ מִצְרַ֛יִם אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃
Translit: vayyaʿavidhū mitṣrayim ʾeth-benē yisråʾēl befårekh
English: And the Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigour:

Hebrew: וַיְמָרְר֨וּ אֶת־חַיֵּיהֶ֜ם בַּעֲבֹדָ֣ה קָשָׁ֗ה בְּחֹ֨מֶר֙ וּבִלְבֵנִ֔ים וּבְכָל־עֲבֹדָ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה אֵ֚ת כָּל־עֲבֹ֣דָתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־עָבְד֥וּ בָהֶ֖ם בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃
Translit: vaymårrū ʾeth-ḥayyēhem baʿavōdhåh qåshåh beḥōmer ūvilvēnîm ūvekhål-ʿavōdhåh bassådheh ʾēth kål-ʿavōdhåthåm ʾasher-ʿåvdhū våhem befårekh
English: And they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in morter, and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field: all their service, wherein they made them serve, was with rigour.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֖ת הָֽעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאַחַת֙ שִׁפְרָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית פּוּעָֽה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer melekh mitṣrayim lamyalledhōth håʿivriyyōth ʾasher shēm håʾaḥath shifråh veshēm hasshēnîth pūʿåh
English: And the king of Egypt spake to the Hebrew midwives, of which the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah:

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בְּיַלֶּדְכֶן֙ אֶת־הָֽעִבְרִיּ֔וֹת וּרְאִיתֶ֖ן עַל־הָאָבְנָ֑יִם אִם־בֵּ֥ן הוּא֙ וַהֲמִתֶּ֣ן אֹת֔וֹ וְאִם־בַּ֥ת הִ֖יא וָחָֽיָה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer beyalledhkhen ʾeth-håʿivriyyōth ūreʾîthen ʿal-håʾåvnåyim ʾim-bēn hūʾ vahamitten ʾōthō veʾim-bath hîʾ våḥåyåh
English: And he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them upon the stools; if it be a son, then ye shall kill him: but if it be a daughter, then she shall live.

Hebrew: וַתִּירֶ֤אןָ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹת֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְלֹ֣א עָשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ן מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם וַתְּחַיֶּ֖יןָ אֶת־הַיְלָדִֽים׃
Translit: vattîreʾnå hamyalledhōth ʾeth-håʾelōhîm velōʾ ʿåsū kaʾasher dibber ʾalēhen melekh mitṣråyim vatteḥayyenå ʾeth-haylådhîm
English: But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the men children alive.

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֨יִם֙ לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֔ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ן מַדּ֥וּעַ עֲשִׂיתֶ֖ן הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַתְּחַיֶּ֖יןָ אֶת־הַיְלָדִֽים׃
Translit: vayyiqråʾ melekh-mitṣrayim lamyalledhōth vayyōʾmer låhen maddūaʿ ʿasîthen haddåvår hazzeh vatteḥayyenå ʾeth-haylådhîm
English: And the king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said unto them, Why have ye done this thing, and have saved the men children alive?

Hebrew: וַתֹּאמַ֤רְןָ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹת֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה כִּ֣י לֹ֧א כַנָּשִׁ֛ים הַמִּצְרִיֹּ֖ת הָֽעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת כִּֽי־חָי֣וֹת הֵ֔נָּה בְּטֶ֨רֶם תָּב֧וֹא אֲלֵהֶ֛ן הַמְיַלֶּ֖דֶת וְיָלָֽדוּ׃
Translit: vattōʾmarnå hamyalledhōth ʾel-parʿōh kî lōʾ khannåshîm hammitṣriyyōth håʿivriyyōth kî-ḥåiōth hēnnåh beṭerem tåvōʾ ʾalēhen hamyalledheth veyålådhū
English: And the midwives said unto Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women; for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives come in unto them.

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥יטֶב אֱלֹהִ֖ים לַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֑ת וַיִּ֧רֶב הָעָ֛ם וַיַּֽעַצְמ֖וּ מְאֹֽד׃
Translit: vayyēṭev ʾelōhîm lamyalledhōth vayyirev håʿåm vayyaʿatṣmū meʾōdh
English: Therefore God dealt well with the midwives: and the people multiplied, and waxed very mighty.

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כִּֽי־יָֽרְא֥וּ הַֽמְיַלְּדֹ֖ת אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיַּ֥עַשׂ לָהֶ֖ם בָּתִּֽים׃
Translit: vayhî kî-yårʾū hamyalledhōth ʾeth-håʾelōhîm vayyaʿas låhem båttîm
English: And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that he made them houses.

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו פַּרְעֹ֔ה לְכָל־עַמּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹ֑ר כָּל־הַבֵּ֣ן הַיִּלּ֗וֹד הַיְאֹ֨רָה֙ תַּשְׁלִיכֻ֔הוּ וְכָל־הַבַּ֖ת תְּחַיּֽוּן׃
Translit: vaytṣav parʿōh lekhål-ʿammō lēʾmōr kål-habbēn hayyillōdh hayʾōråh tashlîkhuhū vekhål-habbath teḥayyūn
English: And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אִ֖ישׁ מִבֵּ֣ית לֵוִ֑י וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־בַּת־לֵוִֽי׃
Translit: vayyēlekh ʾîsh mibbēth lēvî vayyiqqaḥ ʾeth-bath-lēvî
English: And there went a man of the house of Levi, and took to wife a daughter of Levi.

Hebrew: וַתַּ֥הַר הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתֵּ֤רֶא אֹתוֹ֙ כִּי־ט֣וֹב ה֔וּא וַֽתִּצְפְּנֵ֖הוּ שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה יְרָחִֽים׃
Translit: vattahar håʾisshåh vattēledh bēn vattēreʾ ʾōthō kî-ṭōv hūʾ vattitṣpenēhū shelōshåh yeråḥîm
English: And the woman conceived, and bare a son: and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months.

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָכְלָ֣ה עוֹד֮ הַצְּפִינוֹ֒ וַתִּֽקַּֽח־לוֹ֙ תֵּ֣בַת גֹּ֔מֶא וַתַּחְמְרָ֥ה בַחֵמָ֖ר וּבַזָּ֑פֶת וַתָּ֤שֶׂם בָּהּ֙ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד וַתָּ֥שֶׂם בַּסּ֖וּף עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
Translit: velōʾ-yåkhlåh ʿōdh hatṣṣefînō vattiqqaḥ-lō tēvath gōmeʾ vattaḥmeråh vaḥēmår ūvazzåfeth vattåsem båhh ʾeth-hayyeledh vattåsem bassūf ʿal-sefath hayʾōr
English: And when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and put the child therein; and she laid it in the flags by the river's brink.

Hebrew: וַתֵּתַצַּ֥ב אֲחֹת֖וֹ מֵרָחֹ֑ק לְדֵעָ֕ה מַה־יֵּעָשֶׂ֖ה לֽוֹ׃
Translit: vattēthatṣṣav ʾaḥōthō mēråḥōq ledhēʿåh mah-yēʿåseh lō
English: And his sister stood afar off, to wit what would be done to him.

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤רֶד בַּת־פַּרְעֹה֙ לִרְחֹ֣ץ עַל־הַיְאֹ֔ר וְנַעֲרֹתֶ֥יהָ הֹלְכֹ֖ת עַל־יַ֣ד הַיְאֹ֑ר וַתֵּ֤רֶא אֶת־הַתֵּבָה֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַסּ֔וּף וַתִּשְׁלַ֥ח אֶת־אֲמָתָ֖הּ וַתִּקָּחֶֽהָ
Translit: vattēredh bath-parʿōh lirḥōtṣ ʿal-hayʾōr venaʿarōthehå hōlekhōth ʿal-yadh hayʾōr vattēreʾ ʾeth-hattēvåh bethōkh hassūf vattishlaḥ ʾeth-ʾamåthåhh vattiqqåḥehå
English: And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to wash herself at the river; and her maidens walked along by the river's side; and when she saw the ark among the flags, she sent her maid to fetch it.

Hebrew: וַתִּפְתַּח֙ וַתִּרְאֵ֣הוּ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד וְהִנֵּה־נַ֖עַר בֹּכֶ֑ה וַתַּחְמֹ֣ל עָלָ֔יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר מִיַּלְדֵ֥י הָֽעִבְרִ֖ים זֶֽה׃
Translit: vattiftaḥ vattirʾēhū ʾeth-hayyeledh vehinnēh-naʿar bōkheh vattaḥmōl ʿålåv vattōʾmer miyyaldhē håʿivrîm zeh
English: And when she had opened it, she saw the child: and, behold, the babe wept. And she had compassion on him, and said, This is one of the Hebrews' children.

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֲחֹתוֹ֮ אֶל־בַּת־פַּרְעֹה֒ הַאֵלֵ֗ךְ וְקָרָ֤אתִי לָךְ֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה מֵינֶ֔קֶת מִ֖ן הָעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת וְתֵינִ֥ק לָ֖ךְ אֶת־הַיָּֽלֶד׃
Translit: vattōʾmer ʾaḥōthō ʾel-bath-parʿōh haʾēlēkh veqåråʾthî låkh ʾisshåh mēneqeth min håʿivriyyōth vethēniq låkh ʾeth-hayyåledh
English: Then said his sister to Pharaoh's daughter, Shall I go and call to thee a nurse of the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?

Hebrew: וַתֹּֽאמֶר־לָ֥הּ בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵ֑כִי וַתֵּ֨לֶךְ֙ הָֽעַלְמָ֔ה וַתִּקְרָ֖א אֶת־אֵ֥ם הַיָּֽלֶד׃
Translit: vattōʾmer-låhh bath-parʿōh lēkhî vattēlekh håʿalmåh vattiqråʾ ʾeth-ʾēm hayyåledh
English: And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Go. And the maid went and called the child's mother.

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֧אמֶר לָ֣הּ בַּת־פַּרְעֹ֗ה הֵילִ֜יכִי אֶת־הַיֶּ֤לֶד הַזֶּה֙ וְהֵינִקִ֣הוּ לִ֔י וַאֲנִ֖י אֶתֵּ֣ן אֶת־שְׂכָרֵ֑ךְ וַתִּקַּ֧ח הָאִשָּׁ֛ה הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַתְּנִיקֵֽהוּ׃

English: And Pharaoh's daughter said unto her, Take this child away, and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child, and nursed it.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ בְּמִדְיָ֔ן לֵ֖ךְ שֻׁ֣ב מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּי־מֵ֨תוּ֙ כָּל־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים הַֽמְבַקְשִׁ֖ים אֶת־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃

English: And the LORD said unto Moses in Midian, Go, return into Egypt: for all the men are dead which sought thy life.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֣וֹ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֗יו וַיַּרְכִּבֵם֙ עַֽל־הַחֲמֹ֔ר וַיָּ֖שָׁב אַ֣רְצָה מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־מַטֵּ֥ה הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדֽוֹ׃

English: And Moses took his wife and his sons, and set them upon an ass, and he returned to the land of Egypt: and Moses took the rod of God in his hand.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ בְּלֶכְתְּךָ֙ לָשׁ֣וּב מִצְרַ֔יְמָה רְאֵ֗ה כָּל־הַמֹּֽפְתִים֙ אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֣מְתִּי בְיָדֶ֔ךָ וַעֲשִׂיתָ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַאֲנִי֙ אֲחַזֵּ֣ק אֶת־לִבּ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א יְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָעָֽם׃

English: And the LORD said unto Moses, When thou goest to return into Egypt, see that thou do all those wonders before Pharaoh, which I have put in thine hand: but I will harden his heart, that he shall not let the people go.

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר אֵלֶ֗יךָ שַׁלַּ֤ח אֶת־בְּנִי֙ וְיַֽעַבְדֵ֔נִי וַתְּמָאֵ֖ן לְשַׁלְּח֑וֹ הִנֵּה֙ אָנֹכִ֣י הֹרֵ֔ג אֶת־בִּנְךָ֖ בְּכֹרֶֽךָ׃

English: And I say unto thee, Let my son go, that he may serve me: and if thou refuse to let him go, behold, I will slay thy son, even thy firstborn.

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י בַדֶּ֖רֶךְ בַּמָּל֑וֹן וַיִּפְגְּשֵׁ֣הוּ יְהוָ֔ה וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ הֲמִיתֽוֹ׃

English: And it came to pass by the way in the inn, that the LORD met him, and sought to kill him.

English: Then Zipporah took a sharp stone, and cut off the foreskin of her son, and cast it at his feet, and said, Surely a bloody husband art thou to me.

Hebrew: וַיִּ֖רֶף מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אָ֚ז אָֽמְרָ֔ה חֲתַ֥ן דָּמִ֖ים לַמּוּלֹֽת׃

English: So he let him go: then she said, A bloody husband thou art, because of the circumcision.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן לֵ֛ךְ לִקְרַ֥את מֹשֶׁ֖ה הַמִּדְבָּ֑רָה וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַֽיִּפְגְּשֵׁ֛הוּ בְּהַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וַיִּשַּׁק־לֽוֹ׃

English: And the LORD said to Aaron, Go into the wilderness to meet Moses. And he went, and met him in the mount of God, and kissed him.

English: And Moses told Aaron all the words of the LORD who had sent him, and all the signs which he had commanded him.

English: And Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of Israel:

English: And Aaron spake all the words which the LORD had spoken unto Moses, and did the signs in the sight of the people.

English: And the people believed: and when they heard that the LORD had visited the children of Israel, and that he had looked upon their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshipped.

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֗ר בָּ֚אוּ מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י וְיָחֹ֥גּוּ לִ֖י בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃

English: And afterward Moses and Aaron went in, and told Pharaoh, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may hold a feast unto me in the wilderness.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה מִ֤י יְהוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶשְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹל֔וֹ לְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לֹ֤א יָדַ֨עְתִּי֙ אֶת־יְהוָ֔ה וְגַ֥ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֹ֥א אֲשַׁלֵּֽחַ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer parʿōh mî yehvåh ʾasher ʾeshmaʿ beqōlō leshallaḥ ʾeth-yisråʾēl lōʾ yådhaʿtî ʾeth-yehvåh vegham ʾeth-yisråʾēl lōʾ ʾashallēaḥ
English: And Pharaoh said, Who is the LORD, that I should obey his voice to let Israel go? I know not the LORD, neither will I let Israel go.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָעִבְרִ֖ים נִקְרָ֣א עָלֵ֑ינוּ נֵ֣לֲכָה נָּ֡א דֶּרֶךְ֩ שְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת יָמִ֜ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֗ר וְנִזְבְּחָה֙ לַֽיהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ פֶּ֨ן־יִפְגָּעֵ֔נוּ בַּדֶּ֖בֶר א֥וֹ בֶחָֽרֶב׃
Translit: vayyōʾmerū ʾelōhē håʿivrîm niqråʾ ʿålēnū nēlakhåh nåʾ derekh shelōsheth yåmîm bammidhbår venizbeḥåh laihvåh ʾelōhēnū pen-yifgåʿēnū baddever ʾō veḥårev
English: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם לָ֚מָּה מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן תַּפְרִ֥יעוּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם מִמַּֽעֲשָׂ֑יו לְכ֖וּ לְסִבְלֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾalēhem melekh mitṣrayim låmmåh mōsheh veʾaharōn tafrîʿū ʾeth-håʿåm mimmaʿasåv lekhū lesivlōthēkhem
English: And the king of Egypt said unto them, Wherefore do ye, Moses and Aaron, let the people from their works? get you unto your burdens.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה הֵן־רַבִּ֥ים עַתָּ֖ה עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהִשְׁבַּתֶּ֥ם אֹתָ֖ם מִסִּבְלֹתָֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer parʿōh hēn-rabbîm ʿattåh ʿam håʾåretṣ vehishbattem ʾōthåm missivlōthåm
English: And Pharaoh said, Behold, the people of the land now are many, and ye make them rest from their burdens.

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו פַּרְעֹ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא אֶת־הַנֹּגְשִׂ֣ים בָּעָ֔ם וְאֶת־שֹׁטְרָ֖יו לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaytṣav parʿōh bayyōm hahūʾ ʾeth-hannōghesîm båʿåm veʾeth-shōṭeråv lēʾmōr
English: And Pharaoh commanded the same day the taskmasters of the people, and their officers, saying,

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תֹאסִפ֞וּן לָתֵ֨ת תֶּ֧בֶן לָעָ֛ם לִלְבֹּ֥ן הַלְּבֵנִ֖ים כִּתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֑ם הֵ֚ם יֵֽלְכ֔וּ וְקֹשְׁשׁ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם תֶּֽבֶן׃
Translit: lōʾ thōʾsifūn låthēth teven låʿåm lilbōn hallevēnîm kithmōl shilshōm hēm yēlekhū veqōsheshū låhem teven
English: Ye shall no more give the people straw to make brick, as heretofore: let them go and gather straw for themselves.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מַתְכֹּ֨נֶת הַלְּבֵנִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵם֩ עֹשִׂ֨ים תְּמ֤וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁם֙ תָּשִׂ֣ימוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם לֹ֥א תִגְרְע֖וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־נִרְפִּ֣ים הֵ֔ם עַל־כֵּ֗ן הֵ֤ם צֹֽעֲקִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר נֵלְכָ֖ה נִזְבְּחָ֥ה לֵאלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translit: veʾeth-mathkōneth hallevēnîm ʾasher hēm ʿōsîm temōl shilshōm tåsîmū ʿalēhem lōʾ thighreʿū mimmennū kî-nirpîm hēm ʿal-kēn hēm tṣōʿaqîm lēʾmōr nēlekhåh nizbeḥåh lēʾlōhēnū
English: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be idle; therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.

Hebrew: תִּכְבַּ֧ד הָעֲבֹדָ֛ה עַל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים וְיַעֲשׂוּ־בָ֑הּ וְאַל־יִשְׁע֖וּ בְּדִבְרֵי־שָֽׁקֶר׃
Translit: tikhbadh håʿavōdhåh ʿal-håʾanåshîm veyaʿasū-våhh veʾal-yishʿū bedhivrē-shåqer
English: Let there more work be laid upon the men, that they may labour therein; and let them not regard vain words.

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨צְא֜וּ נֹגְשֵׂ֤י הָעָם֙ וְשֹׁ֣טְרָ֔יו וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֶל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֵינֶ֛נִּי נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֖ם תֶּֽבֶן׃
Translit: vayyētṣeʾū nōghesē håʿåm veshōṭeråv vayyōʾmerū ʾel-håʿåm lēʾmōr kōh ʾåmar parʿōh ʾēnennî nōthēn låkhem teven
English: And the taskmasters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spake to the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will not give you straw.

Hebrew: אַתֶּ֗ם לְכ֨וּ קְח֤וּ לָכֶם֙ תֶּ֔בֶן מֵאֲשֶׁ֖ר תִּמְצָ֑אוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין נִגְרָ֛ע מֵעֲבֹדַתְכֶ֖ם דָּבָֽר׃
Translit: ʾattem lekhū qeḥū låkhem teven mēʾasher timtṣåʾū kî ʾēn nighråʿ mēʿavōdhathkhem dåvår
English: Go ye, get you straw where ye can find it: yet not ought of your work shall be diminished.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥פֶץ הָעָ֖ם בְּכָל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְקֹשֵׁ֥שׁ קַ֖שׁ לַתֶּֽבֶן׃
Translit: vayyåfetṣ håʿåm bekhål-ʾeretṣ mitṣråyim leqōshēsh qash latteven
English: So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble instead of straw.

Hebrew: וְהַנֹּגְשִׂ֖ים אָצִ֣ים לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּלּ֤וּ מַעֲשֵׂיכֶם֙ דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּהְי֥וֹת הַתֶּֽבֶן׃
Translit: vehannōghesîm ʾåtṣîm lēʾmōr kallū maʿasēkhem devar-yōm beyōmō kaʾasher bihyōth hatteven
English: And the taskmasters hasted them, saying, Fulfil your works, your daily tasks, as when there was straw.

Hebrew: וַיֻּכּ֗וּ שֹֽׁטְרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣מוּ עֲלֵהֶ֔ם נֹגְשֵׂ֥י פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר מַדּ֡וּעַ לֹא֩ כִלִּיתֶ֨ם חָקְכֶ֤ם לִלְבֹּן֙ כִּתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם גַּם־תְּמ֖וֹל גַּם־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translit: vayyukkū shōṭerē benē yisråʾēl ʾasher-såmū ʿalēhem nōghesē farʿōh lēʾmōr maddūaʿ lōʾ khillîthem ḥåqkhem lilbōn kithmōl shilshōm gam-temōl gam-hayyōm
English: And the officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaoh's taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, Wherefore have ye not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and to day, as heretofore?

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ שֹֽׁטְרֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּצְעֲק֥וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר לָ֧מָּה תַעֲשֶׂ֦ה כֹ֖ה לַעֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾū shōṭerē benē yisråʾēl vayyitṣʿaqū ʾel-parʿōh lēʾmōr låmmåh thaʿaseh khōh laʿavådhekhå
English: Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried unto Pharaoh, saying, Wherefore dealest thou thus with thy servants?

Hebrew: תֶּ֗בֶן אֵ֤ין נִתָּן֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ וּלְבֵנִ֛ים אֹמְרִ֥ים לָ֖נוּ עֲשׂ֑וּ וְהִנֵּ֧ה עֲבָדֶ֛יךָ מֻכִּ֖ים וְחָטָ֥את עַמֶּֽךָ׃
Translit: teven ʾēn nittån laʿavådhekhå ūlevēnîm ʾōmerîm lånū ʿasū vehinnēh ʿavådhekhå mukkîm veḥåṭåʾth ʿammekhå
English: There is no straw given unto thy servants, and they say to us, Make brick: and, behold, thy servants are beaten; but the fault is in thine own people.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר נִרְפִּ֥ים אַתֶּ֖ם נִרְפִּ֑ים עַל־כֵּן֙ אַתֶּ֣ם אֹֽמְרִ֔ים נֵלְכָ֖ה נִזְבְּחָ֥ה לַֽיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer nirpîm ʾattem nirpîm ʿal-kēn ʾattem ʾōmerîm nēlekhåh nizbeḥåh laihvåh
English: But he said, Ye are idle, ye are idle: therefore ye say, Let us go and do sacrifice to the LORD.

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ לְכ֣וּ עִבְד֔וּ וְתֶ֖בֶן לֹא־יִנָּתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם וְתֹ֥כֶן לְבֵנִ֖ים תִּתֵּֽנּוּ׃
Translit: veʿattåh lekhū ʿivdhū vetheven lōʾ-yinnåthēn låkhem vethōkhen levēnîm tittēnnū
English: Go therefore now, and work; for there shall no straw be given you, yet shall ye deliver the tale of bricks.

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֞וּ שֹֽׁטְרֵ֧י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֹתָ֖ם בְּרָ֣ע לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־תִגְרְע֥וּ מִלִּבְנֵיכֶ֖ם דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyirʾū shōṭerē venē-yisråʾēl ʾōthåm beråʿ lēʾmōr lōʾ-thighreʿū millivnēkhem devar-yōm beyōmō
English: And the officers of the children of Israel did see that they were in evil case, after it was said, Ye shall not minish ought from your bricks of your daily task.

Hebrew: וַֽיִּפְגְּעוּ֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֔ן נִצָּבִ֖ים לִקְרָאתָ֑ם בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מֵאֵ֥ת פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vayyifgeʿū ʾeth-mōsheh veʾeth-ʾaharōn nitṣṣåvîm liqråʾthåm betṣēʾthåm mēʾēth parʿōh
English: And they met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way, as they came forth from Pharaoh:

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם יֵ֧רֶא יְהוָ֛ה עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם וְיִשְׁפֹּ֑ט אֲשֶׁ֧ר הִבְאַשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־רֵיחֵ֗נוּ בְּעֵינֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ וּבְעֵינֵ֣י עֲבָדָ֔יו לָֽתֶת־חֶ֥רֶב בְּיָדָ֖ם לְהָרְגֵֽנוּ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmerū ʾalēhem yēreʾ yehvåh ʿalēkhem veyishpōṭ ʾasher hivʾashtem ʾeth-rēḥēnū beʿēnē farʿōh ūveʿēnē ʿavådhåv låtheth-ḥerev beyådhåm lehårghēnū
English: And they said unto them, The LORD look upon you, and judge; because ye have made our savour to be abhorred in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to slay us.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧שָׁב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־יְהוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֗י לָמָ֤ה הֲרֵעֹ֨תָה֙ לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה שְׁלַחְתָּֽנִי׃
Translit: vayyåshåv mōsheh ʾel-yehvåh vayyōʾmar ʾadhōnåi låmåh harēʿōthåh låʿåm hazzeh låmmåh zeh shelaḥtånî
English: And Moses returned unto the LORD, and said, Lord, wherefore hast thou so evil entreated this people? why is it that thou hast sent me?

Hebrew: וּמֵאָ֞ז בָּ֤אתִי אֶל־פַּרְעֹה֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר בִּשְׁמֶ֔ךָ הֵרַ֖ע לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה וְהַצֵּ֥ל לֹא־הִצַּ֖לְתָּ אֶת־עַמֶּֽךָ׃
Translit: ūmēʾåz båʾthî ʾel-parʿōh ledhabbēr bishmekhå hēraʿ låʿåm hazzeh vehatṣṣēl lōʾ-hitṣṣaltå ʾeth-ʿammekhå
English: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in thy name, he hath done evil to this people; neither hast thou delivered thy people at all.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַתָּ֣ה תִרְאֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה לְפַרְעֹ֑ה כִּ֣י בְיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ יְשַׁלְּחֵ֔ם וּבְיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֔ה יְגָרְשֵׁ֖ם מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer yehvåh ʾel-mōsheh ʿattåh thirʾeh ʾasher ʾeʿeseh lefarʿōh kî veyådh ḥazåqåh yeshalleḥēm ūveyådh ḥazåqåh yeghårshēm mēʾartṣō
English: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Now shalt thou see what I will do to Pharaoh: for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a strong hand shall he drive them out of his land.
